stimulusHtml:
Answer the following questions related to sulfur and one of its compounds.

  1. Consider the two chemical species S and S2- .

    1. Write the electron configuration (e.g., 1s2 2s2 . . .) of each species.

    2. Explain why the radius of the S2− ion is larger than the radius of the S atom.

    3. Which of the two species would be attracted into a magnetic field? Explain.

  2. The S2- ion is isoelectronic with the Ar atom. From which species, S2- or Ar, is it easier to remove an electron? Explain.

  3. In the H2S molecule, the H–S–H bond angle is close to 90°. On the basis of this information, which atomic orbitals of the S atom are involved in bonding with the H atoms?

  4. Two types of intermolecular forces present in liquid H2S are London (dispersion) forces and dipole-dipole forces.

    1. Compare the strength of the London (dispersion) forces in liquid H2S to the strength of the London (dispersion) forces in liquid H2O. Explain.

    2. Compare the strength of the dipole-dipole forces in liquid H2S to the strength of the dipole-dipole forces in liquid H2O. Explain.
